intro: Arabis pusilla, commonly known as the mouse-ear cress, is a small flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10-20 centimeters and features basal leaves that are rounded and slightly hairy. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, along stream banks, and in woodland edges. Arabis pusilla is a hardy perennial that is relatively easy to grow in gardens with partial shade.
